title: World-Wide
text:
The U.S. said it would support the temporary waiver of intellectual property provisions to allow developing nations to produce Covid-19 vaccines developed by pharmaceutical companies.

---

A federal judge threw out the CDC's national eviction moratorium after concluding that it was legally unsupportable, upending a Covid-19 relief measure.

---

Rep. Liz Cheney, a critic of Trump's claims that the election was stolen from him, is on the brink of being ousted from her position in the GOP's House leadership ranks.

---

A judge ordered the Justice Department to release a 2019 legal memo recommending that Trump not be prosecuted for obstruction of justice in connection with Mueller's Russia probe.

---

Israel's president handed centrist politician Yair Lapid a shot at forming a government after Netanyahu failed to do so.

---

Russia has maintained a heightened military presence near the Ukrainian border, the U.S. and its NATO allies said.

---

Bill Gates transferred shares valued at nearly $2.4 billion to Melinda Gates as the divorcing couple began dividing their wealth.
